Interested? You can apply via the application form.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Fullstack JavaScript / TypeScript Backend Developer (f/m/d) - Mobility Benefits
description:
Hi,

We are Indre, Marco, Simon, Kasia and Thomas from the Mobility Benefits Squad. Our job is to enable our partners to offer their employees a modern, flexible and sustainable mobility system. As an interdisciplinary team we focus on running our Mobility Benefits solution as part of our urban mobility platform. We care greatly about the quality, scalability, ease of use and a great user experience. We’re looking for a full stack JavaScript engineer to join our squad.

First a quick look at us

Our vision is a planet without traffic jams. Our mission is to transform cities by providing the most convenient and sustainable mobility solutions. We create outstanding products with technical excellence, an agile mindset, an open feedback and failure culture and fun at work. We act as a partner for cities, transport networks and mobility service providers with the goal of making cities smarter and creating an operating system for urban mobility that provides access to appropriate mobility options in urban areas.

How the role works

We gather in small engineering teams organized around specific topics. The individual teams enjoy a high degree of autonomy, trust and responsibility. Innovation is key and very much encouraged and embraced in our teams. We value pragmatism, simplicity and collaboration. We live an open feedback and failure culture, because we know that both are necessary to find proper solutions. With us you will use state of the art technology and work self-determined in small, autonomous and agile teams. moovel (REACH NOW) tries to maintain a culture where engineers are provided with the tools of their choice and a friendly environment in which they can thrive.

Squads at moovel (REACH NOW) choose the tools they regard as the best fit for their problems, at their discretion. Hence the technology stack is rather diverse. We employ a microservice backend architecture based on Docker and AWS. Cloud Services are leveraged wherever they help us to focus on our task. We own the full application lifecycle from ideation phase to end-to-end operating services.

Some of the things you will do

  • Working in the Mobility Benefits Squad together with backend developers, front-end developers, mobile developers, designers and managers.
  • Build microservices with Node.js written in TypeScript and deployed on AWS.
  • Design and implement APIs for internal usage, user interface dashboards and payment for mobility services.
  • As we prefer to be agile, you will participate in defining our products and building them (our product owner values your input)

About you

  • You are experienced in JavaScript/TypeScript
  • You are familiar with building scalable applications and services with Node.js
  • Event driven architecture is not only a buzzword for you
  • You have knowledge in relational databases in example Postgres and you are not afraid of complex queries
  • You are experienced in building services using well-defined APIs
  • You are familiar with building mobile applications
  • You know how to operate services in production – deploying, performance monitoring, tracing problems, and optimization are part of the things you have done in the past
  • We run our services on AWS and monitor them with New Relic. Knowledge with those technologies is a plus and not mandatory from the beginning
  • You are able to communicate verbally and written in English (our squad is international)
  • Must be a caring human being

Benefits

  • Choose your own hardware
  • Working with newest technologies & microservices
  • Be part of an interdisciplinary team of experts
  • Working on products with a high impact on society
  • International teams
  • Flexible working hours
  • Free breakfast, good coffee & fresh fruits
  • Monthly mobility budget

Are you the one who feels addressed? Then we can not wait to meet you soon! Just click the application form!

Yours,

Indre, Marco, Simon, Kasia and Thomas

Click here for the application form!

If you have any questions or are in need for further information feel free to contact Mrs. Nicole Armatowski +49 176 3095 3172

title: Junior software developer
description:
Zo ziet jouw baan eruit

Ben jij starter op de arbeidsmarkt en wil je graag als junior software developer aan de slag? De Volksbank biedt complexe software engineering werkzaamheden binnen een omgeving waar zowel vakmanschap als werkplezier centraal staan.

Wil jij meewerken aan webapplicaties voor instant payments, waardoor een overgemaakt bedrag altijd binnen enkele seconden op je rekening staat? Of een app waarmee je je rekeningoverzichten van verschillende banken in één oogopslag kunt inzien? Als junior software developer bij de Volksbank duik jij in innovaties die de financiële dienstverlening voor miljoenen klanten versnellen, verbeteren en vereenvoudigen. Dankzij jou hebben we een wendbaar applicatielandschap dat op-en-top functioneert.

Bij de Volksbank ontwikkelen we een groot deel van onze responsive webapplicaties zelf. Jij speelt hierin een belangrijke rol. Als junior software developer ontwerp, bouw, test, beheer en documenteer je API’s, die er achter de schermen voor zorgen dat verschillende computerprogramma’s met elkaar kunnen communiceren. Hiervoor gebruik je onder meer innovatieve backend-technieken, microservices, container- en cloudtechnologieën en opensourcesoftware.

In een multidisciplinair scrumteam werk je aan projecten die passen bij jouw ervaring, interesse en achtergrond. Denk aan applicaties voor de nieuwe Europese betaalwet PSD2, internetbankieren, iDeal, engines om processen te automatiseren of interne software voor medewerkers en adviseurs. Je hebt regelmatig contact met je collega’s uit de business om de wensen van klanten en gebruikers helder te krijgen. Die vertaal je samen met je collega’s naar slimme technische oplossingen.

Interesse, maar wil je eerst meer weten? Meld je dan aan voor het koffiemoment en maak kennis met onze developers die je alles kunnen vertellen over de IT uitdagingen, een gemiddelde werkdag of wat je maar wil weten.

Dit krijg je van ons

Complexe uitdagingen

Een IT-bedrijf met de blik op de toekomst. Wij zorgen dat miljoenen mensen altijd en overal kunnen betalen, sparen of geld kunnen lenen om hun ambities waar te maken. Door te blijven innoveren met creatieve IT-oplossingen help jij onze klanten financieel weerbaarder te worden.

Fijne werkplek

Ons kantoor ligt aan de A2 in het gezellige Den Bosch. Wij werken in open agile ruimtes en denken niet in afdelingen. Wil jij je energie kwijt? Onze collega’s houden wel van een spelletje. Er zijn genoeg mogelijkheden: een flipperkast, voetbaltafel of een gameroom met Playstations.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Naast jouw salaris profiteer je van een individueel keuzebudget (IKB), waarmee je zelf kiest wanneer je jouw vakantiegeld en dertiende maand ontvangt. Ook zorgen we voor een goede balans tussen werk en vrije tijd. Jij bepaalt – in overleg – zelf waar en wanneer je werkt.

Jouw ontwikkeling

Binnen onze teams wordt voortdurend informatie en kennis uitgewisseld. Wil je je verdiepen in iOS, een zelfstudie volgen via Google University of jouw Java kennis uitbreiden? Van ons krijg je een go.

Jouw kwaliteiten

Een nieuwsgierige, inhoud gedreven collega met een flinke dosis lef en een aanstekelijk enthousiasme. Dat ben jij in een notendop. Daarnaast beschik je over een kritische blik, het vermogen om complexe problemen te analyseren en de vindingrijkheid om eenvoudige creatieve oplossingen te bedenken. This includes; Manufacturing Design Engineers, Product Designers, Mechanical Engineers, Quality Engineers, Supply Chain Managers, along with our Suppliers. title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Krijg jij een glimlach van het bouwen en beheren van nieuwe IT-functionaliteiten en -applicaties en werk jij graag volgens Agile/Scrum? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou. In ons DevOps team hebben wij ruimte voor een

Full stack Developer (met nadruk op backend development)

Naast het bouwen van een functionaliteit, configureer je zelf de database en test je die ook zelf. De Product Owner zorgt dat de backlog is gevuld met verzoeken vanuit interne teams en hij of zij bepaalt wat er in welke sprint mee gaat.

Wat doe jij

Als Full stack developer werk je aan nieuwe functionaliteiten en bouw je applicaties op basis van stevige analyses. Je prioriteert je werk in samenspraak met je directe collega’s en de Product Owner.

Je maakt intensief gebruik van Continuous Delivery Integration-, Continuous Deployment-omgevingen en -tooling. Benieuwd naar onze Continuous Delivery? Bekijken dan hier onze film!

Het belangrijkste is dat jij jezelf blijft ontwikkelen, plezier in je werk hebt en samen met je collega’s streeft naar een goed resultaat en gevoel van voldoening.

Wat neem jij mee

Ervaring met Java (Spring, ORM, OSGI, Webservices, REST, JSP/Servlets) en met testing. Denk hierbij aan JUnit, Cucumber, Protractor en Karma. Heb je daarnaast nog ervaring met CMS, Jenkins, JIRA, GIT, HTML, CSS, Javascript en XML/JSON, is dat mooi meegenomen.

Jij maakt jouw eigen keuzes. Keuzes die passen binnen een flexibele werkweek (36 uur). Je werkt vanuit ons kantoor in Apeldoorn (De Brug), waarbij je de mogelijkheid hebt om thuis te werken. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Who we are

We're an international creative technology company with offices in Australia and North America. We're a talented and diverse group of creative thinkers, problem solvers, designers, writers, producers and engineers. We work alongside, and embedded within, cultural organisations to help them build people-centric interpretive experiences.

All our projects foreground place, from our ongoing partnership with the Mona museum in Tasmania to our latest immersive audio experiences with the Art Gallery NSW and Smithsonian Institution’s Freer and Sackler Museum. We specialize in creating magical experiences of and about place by seamlessly blending the physical and digital world, connecting people to new ideas derived from their immediate surroundings.

We’re looking for our next back-end developer to join our diverse and multidisciplinary team and bring our product offering to life.  You’ll help create innovative and effective content and experience management solutions that empower our wide range of clients to consistently deliver world-class visitor experiences.

A little about the role...

We build systems that model the relationship between spatial features and the creative works within them, with a focus on human-scale visitor experiences (which is a fancy way of saying "museum", but there’s more to it than that).  We have developed a platform to allow us to work on a large number of simultaneous creative projects with both generalised and bespoke features.

We need a Senior Software Engineer to hone our platform to enable us to continually exceed our clients’ expectations. 

You will initially work closely with our platform team and play a key role in determining what Art Processors’ tech-stack looks like in the future. You will grow an innovative yet stable platform and make critical decisions about where to use third party solutions and where to build our own. You balance making solid engineering choices for long-term stability with needing to develop fast solutions for immediate project and client needs. 

We make use of a broad but carefully curated set of technologies for our work, including Python, Django, Docker, GRPC and PostgreSQL/PostGIS, TypeScript and React for front-ends, and a smattering of Rust where appropriate. If you have solid technical skills, a growth mindset and the ability to get stuff done, then this could be the job for you.

We’re an extremely collaborative group, and that’s music to your ears – you are ambitious and humble in equal measure. And you thrive in a creative, team environment. Developers collaborate with designers, architects and other technologists. All are encouraged to work fluidly across domains, contributing to all aspects of the build from concept to final installation.

  You could be the one if you...

  • Have the ability to handle complex projects with multiple technologies and integrations with dynamic requirements
  • Are a nice person who cares about their work
  • Have a strong ability to communicate well in person and in writing
  • Are a curious, questioning person committed to continual learning who looks to make improvements
  • Are comfortable working on multiple projects from the original brief through development and deployment and beyond with minimal oversight required  

Benefits

We promote a friendly, human work environment; providing you with the support, tools and resources to flourish in your role. You'll be able to draw on the support of a widely experienced team while pushing the boundaries of what's possible in your craft while delivering unique experiences to some of the most innovative creative institutions in the world.

In addition to the above, you’ll:

  • Have opportunities to continually learn, grow and develop your skills
  • Have access to benefits which support your wellbeing
  • Be able to work flexibly with access to different leave types and flexible work arrangements
  • Be able to work out of a newly renovated office in vibrant Collingwood

At AP we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our clients. We're committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

title: Full Stack Developer - Data Analytics Product
description:
Full Stack Developer - Data Analytics Product

Railnova is hiring an experienced full stack developer (Python, Javascript and SQL) for our Railgenius software team to bring data analytics to railway end-users.

The Railgenius team is currently composed of a product manager, data scientist and data engineer and leverages our UX designer, infrastructure team and other product development teams at Railnova. We want to reinforce the Railgenius team and product with an experienced full stack developer to make it a stand-alone SaaS web product with a great user experience.

Our customers are very engaged and never shy of feature suggestions, so you'll work with our UX designer, product manager and support team to decide what to implement. You’ll benefit from a lot of autonomy with a fast release cycle.

Real examples of "full stack" work the Railgenius team has done lately

(that might help you to get a better idea of what this full stack position job entails)

  • Design a user-friendly interface for a complex event processing rule engine enabling our users to detect rolling stock failures in real time.
  • Build a powerful data API and graphing tool to offer our clients a way to discover and graph multiple correlated signals in the browser.
  • Design clever database models and API to express multi-tenant sharing of data and complex access permissions, to preserve privacy, security and intellectual property of each party in the data sharing process.
  • Optimize websockets bandwidth to cope with limited client browser capacity, while displaying hundreds of live sensors from a fleet of trains on a single page.
  • Show the live, interpolated position (think Flightradar24 for trains) of trains along railway lines.
  • Talk directly to the customers to understand the desirability and the user fit of what is being built.

Examples of what surrounding team members have done lately

(the Railgenius team is multidisciplinary team as you can see)

  • Data scientists trained a physical model on 24 month of historic data spanning hundreds of GB on batteries to provide a predictor of battery health while train assets are parked, writing their own software and integrating it in the pipeline and the user front end.
  • Data scientists forecasted future usage of train locomotives by extracting past seasonality in our fine-grained historical data, to better predict maintenance dates.
  • Data engineers optimised heavy SQL queries and indexes to offer great response time for time series querying and pattern search to our end-users.
  • Data engineers migrated our real-time complex event processing framework from a homemade Python base to Apache Kafka to help absorb peak traffic and increase availability.
  • The infrastructure team migrated most of our applications from bare metal servers to the AWS cloud in a few months in order to offer more reliability and improve the life the engineering team.

Requirements

  • You are passionate about making an awesome product for end users.
  • You can use an UX design and think critically about it from your programmer perspective.
  • You have a degree in computer science or engineering or any equivalent proven track record.
  • You are an experienced Python developer (we work with Python Django in the back end and the API).
  • You are an experienced Javascript / ReactJS developer.
  • You can write SQL queries and inspect query performance.
  • You are a good (written) communicator, you like working in a team, and speak to customers.
  • You are eager to learn or dig deeper in:
  • Working with processing jobs on streaming data using the Apache Kafka API.
  • Querying and indexing large amount of unstructured data (10TB+, 7B+ rows).
  • GIS SQL, PostgreSQL limits, and query optimisation.
  • Docker and Kubernetes and working with AWS.

What we offer

We want you to continue your personal development journey at Railnova. You’ll be given space and time for deep focus on your work and be exposed to a technical and caring team and be given the opportunity to perfect your software engineering skills. On top of that, you'll get:

  • A full-time job close to Brussels South Train Station.
  • Space to grow through deep focus on your work, one conference per year of your choice, extra courses and self-learning.
  • A young, multidisciplinary and dynamic team in a medium sized scale-up (~30 employees), with a rock-solid, subscription-based business model in IoT and Data Analytics.
  • A large collection of perks including a smartphone, laptop of your choice, an extra healthcare insurance, transport card and (depending on need) company car.
  • An open culture and nurture creativity, while keeping our clients and the rest of the team in mind at all times.
  • A balanced work environment (work from home, flexible working hours, no meetings, no emails).
  • Lunch delivered to the office every day.

title: Backend-Entwickler in Hamburg (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind ein junges Team und bauen die wahrscheinlich besten Softwarelösungen für die Probleme der Versicherungs- und Finanzdienstleister. Unsere Vision ist die Digitalisierung einer noch rückständigen Branche. Dafür erarbeiten wir laufend neue Lösungen und Tools. Beispielsweise bauen wir die vielleicht geilsten Vergleichsrechner der Versicherungsbranche, sorgen dafür, dass über 1 Mio. Dokumente nicht im analogen Briefkasten landen … und, und, und…! Wir sind ein rein inhabergeführtes Unternehmen, sprich keiner kann uns reinquatschen.

Dein Aufgabenbereich

Als Teil eines agilen Teams entwickelst du alles: Von technischen Lösungen für komplexe Probleme bis hin zur Schnittstellendefinition per OpenApi. Durch deine gute Kenntnis mit mindestens einem gängigen Framework findest du dich schnell in unseren Applikationen zurecht, die abhängig von den Anforderungen mit verschiedenen Frameworks umgesetzt werden. Wir sind ein junges Unternehmen und entwickeln qualitativ hochwertigen Code auf Basis von PHP 7. Dabei helfen uns neben manuellen Codereviews auch automatische Checks per CI-Tools wie Travis, Scrutinizer oder Codecov.

Unser Tech Stack

PHP, MySQL, Rust, Laravel, Symfony, MongoDB, AWS, Docker, Open API, Git

Das hilft dir dabei

  • Praktische Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung komplexer PHP-Applikationen

  • Fundierte Fähigkeiten, sich in vorhandenen Quellcode zurecht zu finden

  • Du hast bereits Berufserfahrung oder hast ein abgeschlossenes IT-Studium bzw. eine relevante Berufsausbildung

  • Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit / Gute Deutsch-Kenntnisse

  • Eigenständiges, lösungsorientiertes und strukturiertes Arbeiten

  • Hoher Qualitätsanspruch

Wir bieten dir

Unsere Arbeitsweise

  • Die Möglichkeit, das Unternehmen, den Tech-Stack und die Ziele mitzugestalten

  • Nachhaltige, qualitätsbewusste Entwicklungen mit wertschaffenden Ergebnissen

  • Freiraum für persönliche Weiterentwicklung

  • Wertschätzung für geleistete Arbeit: Du bist uns wichtig. Wir sind dir wichtig

  • Stark wachsendes Unternehmen ohne Investorendruck

  • Meinungsaustausch statt Austausch deiner Meinung

  • Für jeden Vorschlag eine neutrale Diskussion zulassen

  • Vertrauen statt Stechuhr

Unsere Benefits

  • Mach doch was Du willst: Freie Hard- und Softwarewahl

  • Hochleveln? Individuelle Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

  • Gewinne, Gewinne, Gewinne: Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Mitarbeiterrabattprogramm

  • Bürohunde (Ja, ein HUND im Büro!)

  • Kostenloser Treibstoff (Kaffee, Tee, Wasser und Säfte)

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten für Früh- und Spätaufsteher (Wirklich? Ja, ernsthaft!)

  • Heimscheißer? Home-Office-Möglichkeiten!

  • Möglichkeit zur persönlichen Versicherungsberatung (Wenn nicht bei uns, wo sonst?!)

  • Ein sicherer Arbeitsplatz im Herzen von ‚Hamburch‘, in einem stark wachsenden Unternehmen

Werde Teil unseres Teams

Interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf deinen CV mit Gehaltsvorstellungen. Weitere Infos findest du hier: https://jobs.demv-systems.de/

Ansprechpartner sind Alexander (IT-Leiter für Softwareentwicklung) und Katja (Teamentwicklung) Telefon: 040 - 460 93 299

DEMV Systems GmbH - Dammtorwall 7a - 20354 Hamburg.

Wir freuen uns auf Dich!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Schneider Electric™ creates connected technologies that reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives. Our 160,000 employees thrive in more than 100 countries. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Help us deliver solutions that ensure Life Is On everywhere, for everyone and at every moment: We Are Schneider Electric.

Great people make Schneider Electric a great company.

What do you get to do in this position? The Data Services Data Engineer will develop, maintain and improve of data delivery through the North America (NAM) Data Warehouse platforms. The right person in this role will support overall improvements in data architecture, metric definition and processes to support business data and analytical initiatives. Our Data Engineers provide guidance and support to team members in the Data Services team and our business partners.

This will be your next career if you like to:

  • Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design and deliver enterprise and departmental data solutions to support business intelligence, data warehousing and reporting and machine learning requirements.

  • Implement solutions that are reliable and scalable to meet the service levels associated with mission-critical solutions.

  • Participate in and enhance our DevOp practice to insure highly available solutions and quick issue resolution.

  • Translate business requirements into data pipelines and data stores to support of business requirements.

  • Work with Data and Solution Architects to define and implement migration strategies from legacy systems to cloud architecture and technologies.

  • Provide team feedback to optimize delivery of our solutions.

The right candidate will have the following capabilities and experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in IT/Systems field or equivalent experience.

  • 3 years relevant experience in Data Engineering.

  • Demonstrated experience with primary AWS services such as EC2, EMR, S3, IAM policies, Cloudwatch, Cloud Formation, SES.

  • Demonstrated experience with Cloud Services for data handling and database technologies (Lambda, DMS, Kafka, Spark, Redshift, Hadoop, Airflow, etc.).

  • Demonstrated experience with modern programming languages such as Python, Scala or Java.

  • Experience designing and building systems to process large volumes of heterogeneous data, real time and batch, to deliver complex data solutions that make the most of the elastic capabilities of Cloud services to maximize performance while minimizing waste.

  • Command of advanced SQL queries and programming.

  • Experience contributing to and following architecture, design and implementation best practices.

  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to assimilate information and quickly discern the most relevant facts and recommend creative, practical design solution. Ability to think outside-the-box a real asset.

  • Demonstrated ability to deliver using Agile/Scrum project methodology.

  • Excellent communication, presentation, influencing, and reasoning capabilities.

  • Desire to take the initiative moving projects/ideas forward with clarity.

  • Leadership skills to lead and mentor cross-functional teams towards common solutions.

  • Knowledge of legacy data warehousing tools and technology is an asset Examples: Dimensional Models, Informatica PowerCenter, Informatica Cloud, MS Integration Services, Alteryx, Oracle, MS SQL Server etc.

We seek out and reward people for being straightforward, open, passionate, effective and challenging the status quo. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We’re looking for people with a passion for success — on the job and beyond. See what our people have to say about working for Schneider Electric: Our People.

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled.

Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
Job Overview:

We are looking to expand our iOS engineering team by bringing in someone who can build, scale, and deploy high-quality applications to the App Store. You will have an opportunity to work very closely with our server-side engineers, designers, and product team and have the ability to make a significant impact on an application that has been featured in the App Store for over six months straight and used by thousands of customers on a daily basis. This role would be ideal for someone who wants to work with the latest iOS technologies (Swift, GraphQL, Apollo) and help drive a rapidly growing business.

How we’ve built our iOS app.. We have a fully automated CI process to test and build our app. We've used a MVVM architecture from day one. Our API schema is generated automatically and is typesafe (via GraphQL) Our APIs have all been collaboratively designed by iOS, frontend, and backend engineers. We invest in continuing education and tooling to make developers’ lives easier.

Check out what the team has been working on.. Personalization. We’re enhancing our shopping experience to use user feedback and data to further personalize search results to each user. Speed and Reliability. We’re improving our real time monitoring and alerting for better visibility into the health of our systems. Search and Discovery. We’re adding lots of new ways for customers to find the products that are right for them. We’re giving them the tools they want to make informed decisions on both fit and style.

What we’re looking for.. 4+ years of iOS software development experience. Experience with our core language - Swift (and Ruby is a plus). We prefer candidates with experience in our stack but we also highly value strong coding fundamentals and the ability to learn new technologies quickly. Strong experience with API design. We use GraphQL and the Apollo client for our APIs. User-focused, team players who are excited to tackle big problems.

How we work.. Iteratively. We do weekly sprints, frequent testing builds, and timely code reviews in order to ship quickly and minimize bugs.

Collaboratively. As software engineers, we work very closely with Product and Design to clarify what's possible, what's easy, what's difficult, and what opportunities we see from a technical and non-technical perspective.

With focus. We strive to give engineers discrete areas of focus so they can take ownership of their codebase and build systems the way they want.

title: Full-Stack Web Developer
description:
A full-stack programmer is a person who is comfortable working with all the technologies required to get an idea to a finished product. This individual is familiar with all the layers of software development and has a fair knowledge of networking, database, user interface, API, security, etc.

An aggressively growing technology company focused on passenger transportation and customer interaction is seeking a talented and dedicated Full-Stack Web Developer to join our team in a highly collaborative, fast-paced, rewarding environment. Our ideal candidate has a passion for code, a hunger to take on challenging and exciting projects as well as an unrelenting drive to learn and teach others.

This role will develop, enhance, and sustain innovative solutions to improve the customer experience. You will implement complex software in accordance with project requirements, design, and industry best practices. You will also review designs and participate in meaningful collaboration sessions on how to solve customer problems and participate in determining scope for new projects. You will own components of the architecture and direct the work of other team members; scaling projects efficiently while maximizing performance and minimizing costs and ensuring quality.

This position is anticipated to be full time, but there is an opportunity for flexibility if desired.

Expected Salary Range: 90K+, commensurate with experience

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Code, test, debug, document and maintain software applications using established coding standards and methodologies.
  • Provide technical guidance in software design and development activities and coordinate strategies amongst teams to ensure technologies are interconnected and product lines are working smoothly.
  • Participate in Scrum activities, perform code reviews, contribute to a high performing, growing team.
  • Own component(s) of the architecture and direct the work of other team members.
  • Ensure new software meets quality standards through writing unit and automated tests.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, resolve product issues as they arise.
  • Assist in designing interfaces to improve the user experience.
  • Support the application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support). Follow established development, documentation, testing and deployment processes.
  • Gather requirements and suggest solutions; serve as an integrator between business needs and technology solutions.
  • Collaborate with product development team to plan new features.
  • Work cross functionally to resolve complex customer problems.
  • Responsible for managing and maintaining project and work backlog; able to re-prioritize tasks as the business deems appropriate. Identify, track and mitigate risks as appropriate.
  • Other duties may be assigned.

Knowledge and Experience

  • 5+ years professional experience in Javascript web application development
  • 1-3+ years’ experience with NodeJS
  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience as a Full-Stack Web Developer
  • Good knowledge of HTML5, CSS, RESTful architectures
  • Experience creating responsive designs (Bootstrap, mobile, etc.)
  • Experience with cloud based services, such as AWS, GBQ, Google Maps & Transit, etc...
  • Experience with a modern Javascript framework
  • Experience with SQL and MySQL
  • iOS + Android mobile app experience is a plus but is not required
  • Experience with mapping software, API’s Having experience developing for the transportation, mapping, or logistics space is very valuable and desired.

Please submit your resume and references to: jobs@passiotech.com
how_to_apply: Please submit your resume and references to: jobs@passiotech.com

title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
description:
Do you like to break stuff only for the purpose of putting it back together and discovering how it works? Are you passionate about coding and growing your skill set with like-minded people? Do you find fulfillment in creative problem-solving to improve the overall “big picture”? How about having in-depth, probing conversations around Ruby on Rails development projects? If this paragraph has you looking over your shoulder to see if we’re watching you, keep reading. We may have the right work environment and job for you!

N2 is seeking a skilled senior-level Ruby on Rails Web Developer with a passionate, positive attitude and an impressive work ethic to contribute to our fast-growing technology team. The successful candidate can work remotely from their home base in the U.S. or relocate to beautiful coastal Wilmington, North Carolina, to work at our Home Office (which is filled with some pretty cool people, if we do say so ourselves).

Brass tacks: As an experienced, talented web developer, you probably have your pick of future employers. So why choose N2? We’re glad you asked. N2 has an award-winning company culture and we work for a purpose greater than ourselves with our giving program, N2GIVES.

In a typical day as a Ruby on Rails Web Developer, you would:

Write well-designed, testable, and efficient Ruby code using best software development practices. Develop software solutions and features to solve business problems. Create site layout / user interface by using standard HTML / CSS practices. Integrate data from various back-end services and databases. Provide input on, as well as options and recommendations for, software features and system enhancements. Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs.

To land this gig, you need:

3+ years of Ruby on Rails experience. The ability to demonstrate experience and proficiency in reading, writing, and reviewing Ruby on Rails code. The ability to create site layout / user interface using HTML / CSS and React JavaScript libraries. An in-depth understanding of how web applications work – including security, session management, and best development practices. Full working knowledge of MVC application architecture. Comprehensive understanding of relational database systems, object-oriented programming, and web application development. Experience using Agile methodologies and test-driven development. The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly, and master diverse web technologies and techniques. A team player attitude with a desire to be part of an organization making a difference in people’s lives.

It’s not required, but we’d love it if you also have:

A 4-year degree in a computer science-related discipline or a relevant degree.

About our culture: At N2, our team is made up of emotionally healthy people who genuinely enjoy working together in positions they are passionate about. We do this in a drama-free work culture built on trust, respect, and humility. We promote based on consistent, quality performance, and we intentionally nurture our team members’ professional development because we promote from within every chance we get. Our culture is more important to us than our product, though we take a tremendous amount of pride in both. Maybe you’re thinking, “Every company says that kind of thing.” We get it. So check out what others are saying about us:

Inc. 5000: Fastest-Growing Private Companies in the U.S. (8x winner) Glassdoor: Best Places to Work Fortune: Best Place to Work for Recent College Grads, Women, Millennials, and Flexibility Fortune: Best Place to Work – Medium-Size Businesses Entrepreneur: Top Company Culture (2x winner) Outside: Best Place to Work (3x winner) Stevie Awards: Employer of the Year, Media & Entertainment

If all this isn’t enough to excite you, here are some benefits we offer:

Competitive compensation with growth opportunities Generous paid time off, including two weeks at the end of the year – you read that right; it’s our “Holiday Break” and it’s wonderful! A full benefits package with an employer contribution to the medical premium A 401(k) retirement plan with a Safe Harbor match fully vested from the first day you’re eligible, plus free financial planning services Family-focused benefits, including parental leave, Parent Support Group, flexible scheduling, and a yearly marriage stipend Professional development opportunities through Lunch & Learns First-Time Homebuyer Program for mortgage assistance for eligible team members Free, unlimited access to daily in-person or (if you work remote) simulcasted fitness classes and a nutritionist.

We’re looking to fill this position soon, with interviews beginning immediately. If this sounds like your idea of a great work environment, then what are you waiting for? Apply today at application.n2pub.com!

N2 is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, N2 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
how_to_apply: Please apply on our website at application.n2pub.com!

title: Senior Java Entwickler
description:
Senior Java Entwickler

Job description Als profitables, globales und schnell wachsendes SaaS Start-Up aus Berlin, revolutioniert Sellics e-Commerce auf dem größten Online-Marktplatz der Welt: Amazon.

Wir haben eine All-in-One Lösung für Seller und Vendoren auf Amazon entwickelt, um ihren Erfolg auf Amazon zu steigern. Unsere integrierte Toolbox bietet Features für alle Aspekte im Business: Amazon SEO, Profit Analysis, PPC Campaign Management, Product Research, Review und Inventory Management sowie Competitor Tracking.

Wir erweitern unser Tool kontinuierlich durch zusätzliche, spannende Features und gestalten so diese schnell wachsende Branche mit unserer innovativen Software Lösung.

In den letzten Jahren sind wir stark gewachsen., und wir schätzen Ownership und Agilität. Wir hören unseren Kunden aktiv zu und integrieren stets ihr Feedback. Und: Wir achten sehr auf das Wohlbefinden unserer Mitarbeiter! Dadurch freut sich unser Team ein Teil von Sellics zu sein und wird darüber hinaus aktiv in die Entwicklung und den Erfolg der Firma einbezogen.

Wir suchen nach motivierten Java Entwicklern auf senior Level, die sich aktiv und mit einer hands-on Attitüde in die Entwicklung des #1 Tools für Erfolg auf Amazon einbringen wollen! Mit deinem analytischen Mindset löst du komplexe Aufgaben? Du suchst stets und ständig nach der bestmöglichen Lösung? Dann ist dieser Job das Richtige für dich!

Du wirst

  • Microservices bauen, die Millionen Data-Points händeln.
  • die API und DB Infrastructure designen und implementieren.
  • eng mit unserem Produktteam zusammenarbeiten, um die beste User Experience für unsere Nutzer zu kreieren.

Du

  • hast 5+ Jahre Erfahrung als Software Entwickler/in mit Java 8 auf Production-level.
  • kennst dich bestens mit der Cloud aus, vorzugsweise mit AWS.
  • hast ein stark ausgeprägtes DevOps Mindset: Du glaubst daran, dass Entwickler im Deployment, Betrieb und dem Monitoring einer Application involviert sein sollte.
  • hast 5+ Jahre Erfahrung auf Production-level mit relationalen Datenbanken, vorzugsweise Postgres, MySQL und/oder Oracle.
  • kennst dich mit Spring, Spring Boot, Hiberbate/JPA Frameworks aus.
  • hast Erfahrung mit Messaging, Rest, Multithreading, Caching.
  • sind Maven, Git und Jira bekannt.
  • hast idealerweise mit Data-Mining und Machine-Learning for Automation gearbeitet (Bonus).

Benefits:

  • Ein zentrales Office im Herzen von Berlin Mitte mit einer Dachterasse mit Pool.
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten.
  • Budget für Remote Working Days.
  • Flache Hierarchien und offene Kommunikation im Team.
  • Ein hohes Level an Verantwortung und Raum für deine persönliche Entwicklung.
  • Budget für deine persönliche Entwicklung (Self Improvement Grant).
  • Urban Sports Club Mitgliedschaft.
  • Gratis Essen und Drinks, regelmäßige Team Events.
  • Benefits bei Umzug und Visa-Unterstützung für Staatsbürger außerhalb der EU.
  • Unser jährlicher Company Trip – dieses Jahr waren wir in Lissabon!

Interessiert? Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung. Bitte benutze dafür unser Online Bewerbungstool und schick uns deine Bewerbungsunterlagen.

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
Senior Java Developer

Job description As a profitable, global and rapidly expanding SaaS start-up from Berlin, Sellics is revolutionizing commerce on the world’s biggest online marketplace: Amazon.

We have developed an All-in-One solution for sellers and vendors, including everything they need to be successful on Amazon. Our integrated toolbox offers features for all aspects of business: Amazon SEO, Profit Analysis, PPC Campaign Management, Product Research, Review and Inventory Management and Competitor Tracking. And with more exciting features to be added in the future, we continue to shape this fast-growing industry with cutting edge software innovation.

As a bootstrapped company, Sellics values ownership and agility. As such, we are able to listen to customers and incorporate their feedback, and also pay close attention to the well-being of our employees. As a result, staff members not only enjoy working with us, but are actively involved in the development and success of the company.

We are looking for a motivated and hands-on developer who wants to be an active part in developing the #1 tool for Amazon success! If you are into solving complex tasks with an analytical mindset and always strive for the best solution as quickly as possible, this job is for you!

You will

  • Be building microservices that handle billions of data-points.
  • Design and implement the API and DB architecture.
  • Work closely with our Product Team to define the best user experience for our customers.

You

  • Have 5+ years of experience as a software developer with Java8 on  production-level.
  • Are familiar with cloud solutions, preferrably AWS.
  • Have a strong DevOps mindset: You believe a developer should be involved in deploying, running and monitoring an application.
  • Have 5+ years experience of production-level relational databases, Postgres, MySQL and Oracle preferred.
  • Are familiar with Spring, Spring Boot, Hiberbate/JPA Frameworks.
  • Are familiar with Messaging, Rest, Multithreading, Caching.
  • Are familiar with AWS, Maven, Git, Jira.
  • Have basic knowledge of CSS and HTML.
  • Have experience in Data-Mining and Machine-Learning for Automation as a big plus.

Why Sellics?

  • A very well located office in the heart of Berlin Mitte incl. a rooftop terrace with pool.
  • Flexible office hours.
  • Flat hierarchies with open communication.
  • High level of responsibility and space to develop.
  • Urban Sports Club membership.
  • Self Improvement Grant.
  • Free food and drinks, regular team events.
  • Participation in our annual company trip - this year, we've been to Lisbon!

Are you up for the challenge? Apply now via the application form.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Senior Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
description:
Qinous is a meaningful tech company which develops energy storage units for the global microgrid market. We have built an integrated software and hardware solution, allowing off-grid systems to significantly increase their use of renewable energy. After establishing a portfolio of more than 30 projects in five continents and recent funding round, Qinous is building out its engineering team to continue to develop ground breaking monitoring software for our battery management systems and are looking for more talented developers to join our journey.

Do you want to change the future of energy with us?

Your future accomplishments:

  • Develop our web application used to monitor, control, configure and analyse a micro-grid control system.
  • Develop, test and ship software using Typescript, React/Redux, version control, unit tests and continuous integration.
  • As a crucial member of our team, you have the opportunity to influence various aspects of the product, such as overall UX and working methodologies
  • Provide recommendations and ideas for new technologies, methods and improvements.
  • You'll be mentored by a senior developer with the goal of taking over ownership of the frontend over time

Your background:

  • 5+ years of experience as a Frontend Developer for web applications.
  • We consider experience with TypeScript, React and Redux a large plus.
  • Familiarity with dynamic and static type systems (e.g. Java or Kotlin), OOP and functional programming.
  • You value the importance of HTML, CSS and web standards and you care about user experience.
  • Good communication skills and fluency in English and preferably German.

So why should you join us?

  • Work on a technically interesting product with interesting technologies (Kotlin, C++, TypeScript, Structured Text).
  • Become part of a senior team of developers that communicates and works closely together.
  • You have close contact with the end users and have the chance to get instant feedback.
  • You become a vital part of a sustainable company in a future market.
  • The chance to contribute to changing an industry by applying innovative technology in a highly relevant and meaningful field.
  • A chance to be highly involved in the creation and development of the development processes.
  • Short decision-making processes and room for initiative.
  • Competitive compensation and plenty of room for personal growth.
  • An inclusive atmosphere and the chance to work within a team of experts.

Keen on this meaningful challenge? Then we’d love to get to know you better. Submit your application documents online and we’ll get back to you as soon as possible.

Qinous embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to hiring a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Job Description

An exciting opportunity to join a dynamic, innovative team, working on cutting edge technology. Bring your technical engineering expertise and we’ll give you every opportunity to enhance and grow your professional experience.

Where you fit

This is a chance to join one of our new innovation hubs at Shell, bringing your talent and excellent communication skills to a role as DevOps Engineer.

At Shell’s Agile Hub, we’re taking pride in doing things differently – by taking a unique approach of balancing human-centred and digital design with an agile technology capability to tackle complex problems in original ways.

Joining a proactive team of engineers, and with a huge variety of potential projects to grow across the business, you’ll be challenged to think innovatively, with many different areas to investigate.

What’s the role?

As DevOps Engineer, you’ll thrive on working smart, as you build environments for Agile projects, always on the lookout for opportunities and remaining continually curious as to why things happen.

Your responsibilities will be wide-ranging, from responding to and fixing issues of all sizes and prevent them from happening again, to working with subject matter experts to learn new skills and integrate them into team learnings. Other duties will include:

  • Developing alerts to improve our monitoring.
  • Co-ordinating incidents, including alerts to other engineering teams.
  • Writing and refining troubleshooting guides and documentation.

Requirements

What we need from you

We’re keen to hear from men and women with DevOps Engineering experience, relevant expertise as a developer, a strong background in Linux as well as strong Kubernetes experience. Plus, we’d also hope to see as many of the following on your CV:

  • Experience of Agile and/or DAD (Scrum & Kanban), plus experience using Docker and programming in Hashicorp Terraform, Bash, Python and Ansible.
  • Strong experience of Kubernetes in building environments from scratch, preferably over PaaS. Exposure to Kops, Kubespray and Kubeadm is also advantageous
  • An understanding of Microservice based Architecture.
  • An ability to implement infrastructure as code.
  • A strong understanding of web server application design.
  • An understanding of application security and information security controls.
  • Data Science platform experience, plus monitoring and logging platforms, will be an advantage.
  • Knowledge of configuration management tools.
  • Experience in Javascript development and mobile app development is also desirable.

An innovative place to work

There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.

Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.

An inclusive place to work

To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…

  • We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.
  • We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.
  • We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.
  • We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.

A rewarding place to work

Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.

We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Company Description

The world faces energy challenges that are becoming more complex each day. We’re looking for people who share our passion for taking on those challenges with cutting edge technology, innovative thinking and a commitment to properly managed risk. Shell develops and operates some of the largest and most complex projects in the world and we always endeavour to work at the leading edge of technical innovation.

Interested

Click here to apply!

Disclaimer

Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.

Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world.

The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand.

Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Backend Engineer (Ruby)
description:
Mentimeter is a product-first, gender-equal, tech-heavy, fast-growing, inclusive and profitable startup built by engineers. Back in 2014, we felt that boring and inefficient meetings had to go, so we decided to build an interactive presentation service for this. Five years later, we are listed as the fastest growing Swedish startup, have more than 60 million users and customers from over 150 countries; the journey has just begun.

Mentimeter are supporting with relocation.

title: Lead Front End Engineer
description:
Join us as a Lead Front End Engineer

  • Mettle are looking for an experienced Lead React Native Software Engineer to work within our Agile feature teams
  • You'll be leading the Front End Guild team across our key product feature teams, being the subject matter expert for all front end engineers within the business
  • This is an opportunity to achieve excellent exposure in a challenging role and to make a real impact with your work

What you'll do

As a Lead Front End Engineer, you'll recruit and develop talent across the entire team, from budding developers, to accomplished, seasoned developers looking to grow into technology and people leaders. You'll manage a strong, motivated engineering team which understands the importance of continuous testing, shipping and improving with a focus on quality.

You'll be working with stakeholders from all business areas, including Product, Risk, Technology and Design, as well as the Mettle management team, to help drive the direction of development for the Mettle business, putting the long term interests of our customers at the heart of key decisions.

Day-to-day, you'll be:

  • Engaging with the broader bank to help drive technological development across all business areas and making sure that Mettle remains on the front foot in terms of pan-bank engagement
  • Working within an Agile feature team, developing and enhancing the Mettle iOS app
  • Developing clean, elegant, and very reusable code that is easy to maintain and extend
  • Making sure all code meets our coding standards, and taking part in PR’s
  • Writing tests across the test pyramid and holding code coverage in high regard, and exploring and proposing ways to incrementally improve code quality and performance
  • Working collaboratively with the team to resolve technical issues

The skills you'll need

We're looking for a self-motivated engineer with a passion for both business and technology innovation. You'll have deep knowledge of React and be comfortable writing custom JavaScript but also know when to apply off-the-shelf solutions to solve the problem. We also value people who are passionate about user experience and have an eye for improving the UI. In addition, you'll need experience of being an active practitioner in a management or leadership team, with the ability to work well on a personal level with the other key executives.

At Mettle we use a range of technologies across the stack, including GraphQL, Node, React Web, Java, Kafka and Docker, Kubernetes and Terraform. As such, knowledge of these technologies is essential.

You'll also need:

  • Demonstrable delivery of iOS applications to the app store with experience building mobile applications for both iOS and Android
  • Experience with Git, including an understanding of branching and merging workflows
  • To be comfortable working with REST API's using both synchronous and asynchronous patterns
  • Experience with optimising code for performance and quality
  • Experience of working in a test driven development like environment
  • Experience of working in a business with multiple engineering teams
  • Experience of working on a highly secure application

How we'll reward you

In return, we offer a competitive salary and you'll also join our retirement savings plan. You can also choose from a selection of protection, healthcare or lifestyle extras from RBSelect, our fully flexible reward programme.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
Join us as a Platform Engineer

  • This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of Mettle, a new venture currently in its infancy that will be looking to address changing customer needs
  • Working as part of a talented platform engineering team, you'll be developing cloud native infrastructure to run a bank in the most resilient way possible
  • Hone your creative problem solving skills as you take on a challenging role and enjoy a collaborative and supportive culture

What you'll do

As a Platform Engineer, you'll be working with our product, design and operations teams to help build out our next generation banking platforms. Responsible for creating the low level platform and core banking services, you'll help power our web, and mobile user interfaces and clients through our REST APIs.

We know that building high performance, highly scalable, always available, fault tolerant systems is a team game and so we want to know that you work well with others. We strongly believe that you grow a system, rather than build it, so our architecture and infrastructure is designed to allow us to roll small bits of code to production really fast and often.

Day-to-day, you'll be:

  • Working with multiple stakeholders, in both engineering and business capabilities, to understand implementation and process decisions and help improve them
  • Making sure all code meets our coding standards, and taking part in PR’s
  • Working collaboratively with the team to resolve technical issues

The skills you'll need

To succeed in this role, you'll need experience of working in cloud based, continuous deployment type environments, along with good experience of using schedulers like Kubernetes, Mesos, Marathon and containers like Docker. You'll need experience in a highly distributed and highly scalable platform, and you'll be a team player who is used to working well in a collaborative team.

You'll also demonstrate:

  • Terraform skills and experience
  • AWS knowledge
  • Linux admin skills
  • Microservice awareness
  • CI/CD focus and experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills

How we'll reward you

In return, we offer a competitive salary and you'll also join our retirement savings plan. You can also choose from a selection of protection, healthcare or lifestyle extras from RBSelect, our fully flexible reward programme.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Join us as a DevOps Engineer

  • You'll be responsible for demonstrating DevOps technical practices, mentoring, coaching teams, and demonstrating how to measure, understand and visualise the flow and delivery of value through the adoption of DevOps tools, technologies, techniques, patterns, and processes from inception through to technical implementation and delivery
  • You'll be involved in the early stages with a newly developed team within network services, creating automation for customers so they can easily consume network services
  • This is an opportunity to get involved in establishing a new function, collaborating with other teams and to be at the forefront of developing new exciting services

What you'll do

As a DevOps Engineer, you'll work in compliance with the policies and standards of the Agility, DevOps and adjacent centre of excellences (CoE) and enable teams to focus on the continuous delivery of value. You'll be working within feature teams, platforms, domains and CoE initiatives as active engineers, practitioners, mentors and coaches.

You'll be assessing platform and feature teams current levels of DevOps technical capability, utilising the DevOps CoE standard capability model, in order to identify capability gaps and support teams to lose critical gaps and drive continuous improvement and understanding of DevOps and Agile principles and ways of working.

You'll also be:

  • Contributing to building the DevOps engineering capability, culture and mind sets within the organisation
  • Securing strong buy in to DevOps methodologies from the Product Owner, Platform Lead and other key business stakeholders to drive commitment to an alternative way of working driving increased proficiency and ultimately leading to improved customer outcomes
  • Coaching and mentoring the team to higher levels of DevOps capability, to drive continuous improvements and deliver enhancing the end customer experience
  • Supporting the set up of DevOps methodologies and tools within the team and demonstrating technical implementation

The skills you'll need

To succeed in this role, you'll need experience of enterprise continuous integration and continuous development, such as gitlab. You'll be a very capable communicator with the ability to communicate and teach complex technical concepts to your peers and management level colleagues, with good collaboration and stakeholder management skills, along with experience working in an Agile or Scrum environment at an enterprise level.

You'll also need:

  • Experience of network administration
  • Knowledge of cloud infrastructure, such as AWS or MS Azure
  • A willingness to continually learn and evolve with the latest knowledge, concepts and best practice around DevOps methodologies
  • Knowledge of virtualisation, including VM Ware and Cisco ACI

How we'll reward you

In return, we offer a competitive salary and you'll also join our retirement savings plan. You can also choose from a selection of protection, healthcare or lifestyle extras from RBSelect, our fully flexible reward programme.
